definition: erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]

sentences.english: After lunch my father dozes in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 喫過午飯後我父親總在他的椅子上打個盹。

sentences.english: Taking a nap in the recreation facility.
She's texting too and occasionally nodding off.
sentences.chinese: 她還在一邊發短信，偶爾打個盹。

sentences.english: And if I can, I’ll nap again when the urge strikes.
sentences.chinese: 這個時候我一般都會選擇打個盹。

sentences.english: In 30 minutes is appropriate, if there is one thing that a nap is also ok.
sentences.chinese: 以30分鐘左右爲宜，如果有事情打個盹也行。

sentences.english: I sometimes take a catnap in the afternoon.
After eating the pancakes, overflowing with happiness, the old collector said he would take a nap.
sentences.chinese: 老收藏家喫過烤薄餅，滿心歡喜，又想打個盹。

sentences.english: She sank into the easy chair, put her feet up on the footstool, and allowed herself to doze off, just for a bit.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在安樂椅上，雙腳搭在腳蹬上打個盹，就一會兒。

sentences.english: On a side note, You could also try taking a power nap.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以小息充電，打個盹。

sentences.english: I'll meet you at the movies right after I take a little catnap .
sentences.chinese: 我先打個盹再到電影院和你碰面。

sentences.english: The messenger seated on a form after taking that refection, had dropped into a doze.
sentences.chinese: 那信使喫完便餐便在長凳上坐下，打起盹來。

sentences.english: Scientists have shown that individual brain cells take 40 winks when we are tired - even while the rest of the brain is awake.
sentences.chinese: 科學家發現人在疲憊時部分腦細胞會打上一小會兒盹。

sentences.english: I decided to take a nap andpparently ended up sleeping with my mouth wide open since breathing was an issue.
sentences.chinese: 我決定打個盹，嘴巴大張着因爲呼吸很困難。

sentences.english: He naps after lunch every day.
sentences.chinese: 他每天午飯後都打個盹。

sentences.english: I'll take a nap and digest.
sentences.chinese: 我要打個盹好讓食物消化一下。

sentences.english: Sometimes the most spiritual thing you can do is take a nap.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，你能做的最神聖的事情就是打個盹。

definition: erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
